intro: Illecebrum obliquum, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in certain environments.
